rev.comment: /* References */ Retitling - this is a bibliography, not a list of footnoted references
Undid revision 459778557 by [[Special:Contributions/Winooo|Winooo]] ([[User talk:Winooo|talk]]) "Polish-born" is not synonymous with "Polish." She was Polish.
Undid revision 459745759 by [[Special:Contributions/Nihil novi|Nihil novi]] ([[User talk:Nihil novi|talk]]) polish origin, both parents Polish, and born in Poland ( and no perhaps )
Rewording polonium discovery info in lead, delinking to prevent overlink
She was not merely "Polish-born" but Polish (and perhaps also secondarily French).
Undid revision 459612406 by [[Special:Contributions/Winooo|Winooo]] ([[User talk:Winooo|talk]]) - restore information removed w/out an explanation

Revert [[Special:Contributions/Winooo|Winooo]]). I left a message in the talk page to explain you why. I strongly advise you to establish a consensus in the talk page since at least three other wikipedians (including me) seem to disagree with you.

"Pantheon Paris" may be official name, but very few people would refer to it as such, and to an unaccustomed reader it would look like a grammar mistake. This wording makes clear exactly what is being described
The name of building is "Pantheon Paris" according to the official site: http://www.pantheonparis.com/
polish origin, both parents Polish, and born in Poland/// ps. Picasso was Spanish not French
adding cite for c.o.d. in lead
Expanding Curie Institutes mention in introduction
/* Post-war years */ Removed pointless commas and added needed ones.
Adding IPA for Polish birth name
Undid revision 459526938 by [[Special:Contributions/Winooo|Winooo]] ([[User talk:Winooo|talk]]) French Wikipedia has different rules, here [[MOS:FLAG]] applies
name doesn't seem to have been hyphenated — and at any rate, it shouldn't be an n-dash

both parents Polish , so "was a Polish-born" , later French citizenship
Added the ref to NYT article about her ashes getting moved to the Panthéon Paris
Reverted 2 edits by [[Special:Contributions/Winooo|Winooo]] ([[User talk:Winooo|talk]]): Commonly used form in English is Marie Curie per several naming discussions -- see talk page. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
name is Maria NOT Marie , article is English not French
Expanding introduction with rough details of death
Captioning lead image to provide context
/* Pierre's death */ removed italicization of proper name

Undid revision 442586119 by [[Special:Contributions/Rejedef|Rejedef]] ([[User talk:Rejedef|talk]]) "Humanitarian" is not a recognized nationality. The infobox is not a suitable place for a diatribe
moved [[Maria Skłodowska–Curie]] to [[Marie Curie]] over redirect: revert. Bucks consensus
humanitarian, 1st women to receive the Nobel Prize, a bit more of her family
moved [[Marie Curie]] to [[Maria Skłodowska–Curie]]: The real, original name
[Pu387]Add: isbn, postscript. Tweak: url, isbn, pages. Formatted [[WP:ENDASH|dashes]].

/* See also */ Adding a See also.
removed [[Category:Deaths from leukemia]]; added [[Category:Deaths from anemia]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
resolved [[WP:MOSNUM|ambiguous date formats]]; [[WP:MOSNUM|align date formats]] by [[WP:MOSNUMscript|script]]; per [[WP:MOS]], [[WP:MOSTEXT]] and [[WP:Linking]]
1 revision from [[:nost:Marie Curie]]: import old edit, see [[User:Graham87/Import]]
Removing "20000_zl_a_1989.jpg", it has been deleted from Commons by [[commons:User:Jcb|Jcb]] because: Per [[commons:Commons:Deletion requests/Money of Poland]].
Tagging dead link using [[w:WP:CHECKLINKS|Checklinks]], removing duplicate reference that is already quoted as a reference
[[WP:CHECKWIKI]] error 61 fixes + [[WP:GENFIXES|general fixes]], References after punctuation per [[WP:REFPUNC]] and [[WP:PAIC]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7679)
/* Honors */ I'm not sure what was originally stated here, or whether this was added so half-assed. But I tweaked/fixed it.
Cleaned up [[Nobel Prize#Multiple laureates]] pipe link.

clarify: only woman with multiple fields and only person with multiple sciences with link to Nobel_Prize#Multiple_laureates.
/* Honors */ /* Added art ref. Why is this locked? What psycho would mess with HER? */
Undid revision 414457519 by [[Special:Contributions/Austin.g.meyer|Austin.g.meyer]] ([[User talk:Austin.g.meyer|talk]]) Clarification about two nobel prizes.
revert - yes, but this is referring to the fact she received them for two different sciences
Marie Curie is Not the only person to win two noble prizes in science. Fred Sanger won two in Chemistry and John Bardeen won two in Physics.
More comma tweaks, and sourced his death in the section about him as well.
/* New elements */ Tweaks, and source from his article about the way he died.
/* Tributes */ the Year of Marie Curie

Only woman who won twice, only person in 2 diff fields

Citation maintenance. Formatted: publisher, year, location. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself! Please [[User:DOI_bot/bugs|report any bugs]].
Rv. "footnotes =" is exactly the right place to mention notable relatives, per [[Template:Infobox_Scientist#footnotes]]
since the discussion settled on 'agnostic' I add it to the infobox
Rv; about.com is not a [[WP:RS|reliable source]]. According to her biography, she was an agnostic; see discussion at [[Talk:Marie_Curie/Archive_1#Atheist]].
